item.title: Cover may be about to break, 12th January
item.description:
Cars keep driving on cover and there is a plastic temporary cover on it but the cover is almost a hole at this point and you can now see through the cover

item.title: Blocked shot for over a month, 12th January
item.description:

item.title: One large pothole, 2 smaller, 12th January
item.description:
Very deep pothole This Road is a bus route and we have new potholes appearing every day. The repairs are not adequate. The Road needs completely resurfacing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mounthurst Road, Hayes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: White box lines worn off the pavement, 12th January
item.description:
The White Box lines showing where to park on the pavement have worn off. The last line has worn away so you can't see where the white box ends, people are parking right to the end of the pavement and over the alley way which is the road that leads to the houses at the back. Could you please repaint this white box, emergency vehicles won't get up the alley if needed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 108A, Ridgeway West, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: Bin left behind, 12th January
item.description:
Hi - the cleaning crew left a big black bin behind when they completed their round last Monday (5th). It’s the kind they use to put multiple bags in the lorry. Please could someone collect it? It doesn’t belong to the nearby homes. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stanhope Grove, Upper Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen fruits from teh tree, smell and hazard of slipping for the children and parents also the public, 12th January
item.description:
The tree has fruits or seeds that falls on the floor and smells the area awfully and also children. parents and the public are slipping on it, causing falls. It is a hazard and needs to be cleaned and washed away please.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mapledene Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Graffiti on both corners of the estate and on all the bottom balconies, 12th January
item.description:
Wettons were seen painting over the graffiti a couple of weeks ago. Not only did they not try to remove it, they just painted over it in a completely non-matching colour and it wasn’t even thick enough to cover the writing. Frankly, it looks worse than before.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maiden Lane, Barnes Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
